body_html:
@melvinma I think you might have a misunderstanding about variables. From the documentation:

Variables are in-memory buffers containing tensors.

Here are some links to further reading.
https://www.tensorflow.org/versions/master/programmers_guide/variables
https://www.tensorflow.org/versions/master/api_docs/python/tf/Variable
https://www.tensorflow.org/versions/master/api_guides/python/state_ops#Variables

Note that this question is better suited for stackoverflow; we use github for tracking bugs and feature requests. If you have further questions about variables, please ask them on stackoverflow. Thanks!

body:
@melvinma I think you might have a misunderstanding about variables.  From the documentation:

```
Variables are in-memory buffers containing tensors.
```

Here are some links to further reading.
https://www.tensorflow.org/versions/master/programmers_guide/variables
https://www.tensorflow.org/versions/master/api_docs/python/tf/Variable
https://www.tensorflow.org/versions/master/api_guides/python/state_ops#Variables

Note that this question is better suited for stackoverflow; we use github for tracking bugs and feature requests.  If you have further questions about variables, please ask them on stackoverflow.  Thanks!
